text: Hey <@U01E4DUKW12> for just a background image you can actually set that on the dnd section in the hubl markup. You can also do it on the page level in the page editor.
There is not a way to add custom fonts to the font selector drop down. But you can still add custom fonts to the theme the way you would usually include them on any other site

Thanks for the response! I tried setting it in the dnd section but unfortunately I don’t have an absolute url to supply. Setting it at the page level may be an idea - I’ll just have to test it and apply the appropriate css rules beforehand.

How do you intend to set it with CSS without an absolute URL?  is it just stored within the theme files? if so you can just use the relative path along with the get_asset_url() function <@U01E4DUKW12>
```get_asset_url('./relative/path/to/file')```
